values.description:
With this PR you can do the following:

```
IGN_GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH=<path_to_world_files> ign-gazebo -f <a_world_file.sdf>
```

The `<a_world_file.sdf>` can be a file within `<path_to_world_files>`.

This PR requires: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/175/added-ability-to-set-an-environment/diff
values.title: [A-7] Use SystemPaths to find a file

values.description: Currently when entities are removed from the world they are not removed from the scene manager in the Sensor system. This causes an inconsistency between the what's shown by the gui and the camera sensor. This pull request provides a fix. It also adds a test to make sure recreating the entities after removing them does not crash ogre as it has in the past.
values.title: [A-1] Support for removing entities in the Sensor system

summary.raw: Currently when entities are removed from the world they are not removed from the scene manager in the Sensor system. This causes an inconsistency between the what's shown by the gui and the camera sensor. This pull request provides a fix. It also adds a test to make sure recreating the entities after removing them does not crash ogre as it has in the past.
summary.html: Currently when entities are removed from the world they are not removed from the scene manager in the Sensor system. This causes an inconsistency between the what's shown by the gui and the camera sensor. This pull request provides a fix. It also adds a test to make sure recreating the entities after removing them does not crash ogre as it has in the past.

values.title: [A-1]Created clock topic

summary.html:
This PR adds a /world/<world_name>/clock topic that is published every iteration. The intent here is to send time over the ROS bridge, and provide an unthrottled clock topic.

I also added a doxygen tag files while I was updating the documentation.

@carromj , I'm not sure if this is stepping on your distributed simulation work.

values.description:
This installs world to `IGN_DATA_INSTALL_DIR`, which is `<prefix>/share/ignition/ignition-<project_name_lower>`. @\_jrivero\_ , this is different from your suggestion but it is the location that all our ignition projects are currently using for "data". What do you think?

This PR also moves the `gui.config` installation to `IGN_DATA_INSTALL_DIR`.
values.title: [A-7]Install worlds, and move gui.config to IGN_DATA_INSTALL_DIR

This installs world to `IGN_DATA_INSTALL_DIR`, which is `<prefix>/share/ignition/ignition-<project_name_lower>`. @\_jrivero\_ , this is different from your suggestion but it is the location that all our ignition projects are currently using for "data". What do you think?

This PR also moves the `gui.config` installation to `IGN_DATA_INSTALL_DIR`.

This installs world to IGN_DATA_INSTALL_DIR, which is <prefix>/share/ignition/ignition-<project_name_lower>. @_jrivero_ , this is different from your suggestion but it is the location that all our ignition projects are currently using for "data". What do you think?

This PR also moves the gui.config installation to IGN_DATA_INSTALL_DIR.

values.description:
This is ready, test have been added.

This will allow ign-gazebo to be used as a library and allow plugins to be specified via ServerConfig.

# Testing

1. Install all the plugins from the [ign-plugins](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-plugins) repo.
2. Install the last of the [ign-tools prs](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-tools/pull-requests/9).
3. Install this PR.
4. Run `ign launch -f gazebo_plugins.ign`.
values.title: [A-7] Allow programmatic loading of plugins

This will allow ign-gazebo to be used as a library and allow plugins to be specified via ServerConfig.

# Testing

1. Install all the plugins from the [ign-plugins](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-plugins) repo.
2. Install the last of the [ign-tools prs](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-tools/pull-requests/9).
3. Install this PR.
4. Run `ign launch -f gazebo_plugins.ign`.
summary.html:
This is ready, test have been added.

This will allow ign-gazebo to be used as a library and allow plugins to be specified via ServerConfig.

Testing

  1. Install all the plugins from the ign-plugins repo.
  2. Install the last of the ign-tools prs.
  3. Install this PR.
  4. Run ign launch -f gazebo_plugins.ign.

values.description:
depends on this [ign-sensors pull request](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/36/add-logical-camera-sensor/diff)

The logical camera sensor is created using the new SensorFactory class in ign-sensors. IThe sensor relies on information about models in the world, i.e. model names and poses. The system gets this information through components and passes it to the logical camera sensor in ign-sensors.
values.title: [A-8] Add logical camera sensor system

summary.raw:
depends on this [ign-sensors pull request](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/36/add-logical-camera-sensor/diff)

The logical camera sensor is created using the new SensorFactory class in ign-sensors. IThe sensor relies on information about models in the world, i.e. model names and poses. The system gets this information through components and passes it to the logical camera sensor in ign-sensors.

depends on this ign-sensors pull request

values.description:
I encountered a segfault when creating a default constructed `Component`. The test added in 73cc9db demonstrates the problem. I don't see any harm in allowing the use of the default constructor so 5b9399a provides a fix.

The pull request also adds a constructor for `Component` that allows moving the data parameter.
values.title: Add Component default constructor and constructor with moved data

summary.raw:
I encountered a segfault when creating a default constructed `Component`. The test added in 73cc9db demonstrates the problem. I don't see any harm in allowing the use of the default constructor so 5b9399a provides a fix.

The pull request also adds a constructor for `Component` that allows moving the data parameter.
summary.html:
I encountered a segfault when creating a default constructed Component. The test added in 73cc9db demonstrates the problem. I don't see any harm in allowing the use of the default constructor so 5b9399a provides a fix.

The pull request also adds a constructor for Component that allows moving the data parameter.

values.description:
Up until now, the `EntityComponentManager` has been able to handle any arbitrary component type.  However, we've been adding functionality which is not necessarily supported by every type, such as:

* Since pull request #102, only types that have `==` and `!=` operators are supported by functions like `EntityByComponents` and `ChildrenByComponents`.
* Since pull request #147, only registered components can be used with the factory

So I believe it's safe to say we're moving away from supporting general data and adding certain requirements for types that want to be components.

---

 This PR adds the requirement that components inherit from the `BaseComponent` class.

This will be used by follow up pull requests which introduce the ability to serialize and de-serialize individual components, as well as the current state of the entire ECM.
values.title: [A-4] Change void* to BaseComponent* in ECM

summary.raw:
Up until now, the `EntityComponentManager` has been able to handle any arbitrary component type.  However, we've been adding functionality which is not necessarily supported by every type, such as:

* Since pull request #102, only types that have `==` and `!=` operators are supported by functions like `EntityByComponents` and `ChildrenByComponents`.
* Since pull request #147, only registered components can be used with the factory

So I believe it's safe to say we're moving away from supporting general data and adding certain requirements for types that want to be components.

---

 This PR adds the requirement that components inherit from the `BaseComponent` class.

This will be used by follow up pull requests which introduce the ability to serialize and de-serialize individual components, as well as the current state of the entire ECM.
summary.html:
Up until now, the EntityComponentManager has been able to handle any arbitrary component type. However, we've been adding functionality which is not necessarily supported by every type, such as:

  • Since pull request #102, only types that have == and != operators are supported by functions like EntityByComponents and ChildrenByComponents.
  • Since pull request #147, only registered components can be used with the factory

So I believe it's safe to say we're moving away from supporting general data and adding certain requirements for types that want to be components.

This PR adds the requirement that components inherit from the BaseComponent class.

This will be used by follow up pull requests which introduce the ability to serialize and de-serialize individual components, as well as the current state of the entire ECM.

values.description:
This is broken off the `streaming` branch, where I'm working on ECM serialization.

---

Protobuf-related:

* Find protobuf in the top level cmake file together with the rest of dependencies
* Rename variables such as `PROTO_SRC` to include the word `PRIVATE`. The idea is that we may have public messages soon as well, and they need to be handled differently in some places.
* Add the proto sources to the general sources, not only to the networking ones. Since the `msgs` folder is a sibling of `network`, I assume other non-network private messages should also go there?
* Rename the protobuf target to a specific name instead of `protobuf_compilation`.

Others:

* Also made sure that test plugins are not compiled when `BUILD_TESTING=false`. It's something I happened to run into while working on this.
values.title: [A-4] Reorganize private messages cmake code

summary.raw:
This is broken off the `streaming` branch, where I'm working on ECM serialization.

---

Protobuf-related:

* Find protobuf in the top level cmake file together with the rest of dependencies
* Rename variables such as `PROTO_SRC` to include the word `PRIVATE`. The idea is that we may have public messages soon as well, and they need to be handled differently in some places.
* Add the proto sources to the general sources, not only to the networking ones. Since the `msgs` folder is a sibling of `network`, I assume other non-network private messages should also go there?
* Rename the protobuf target to a specific name instead of `protobuf_compilation`.

summary.html:
This is broken off the streaming branch, where I'm working on ECM serialization.

Protobuf-related:

  • Find protobuf in the top level cmake file together with the rest of dependencies
  • Rename variables such as PROTO_SRC to include the word PRIVATE. The idea is that we may have public messages soon as well, and they need to be handled differently in some places.
  • Add the proto sources to the general sources, not only to the networking ones. Since the msgs folder is a sibling of network, I assume other non-network private messages should also go there?
  • Rename the protobuf target to a specific name instead of protobuf_compilation.

Others:

  • Also made sure that test plugins are not compiled when BUILD_TESTING=false. It's something I happened to run into while working on this.

values.description:
This pull request adds preliminary support for contact sensors via a contact system. Each collision entity that has been selected to be a contact sensor will have a `ContactData` component added to it by the contact system. These components get updated by the physics system at each time step. Currently, only the position of the contacts is made available. Normals and wrenches will be added in the future.

**Requires:**

* ~~[ign-msgs #90](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/90/)~~
* [ign-physics #67](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/67)

Note: I have modified pipelines to build ign-msgs and ign-physics from source until they get merged
values.title: [Acropolis] Add contact sensor

summary.raw:
This pull request adds preliminary support for contact sensors via a contact system. Each collision entity that has been selected to be a contact sensor will have a `ContactData` component added to it by the contact system. These components get updated by the physics system at each time step. Currently, only the position of the contacts is made available. Normals and wrenches will be added in the future.

**Requires:**

* [ign-physics #67](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/67)

summary.html:
This pull request adds preliminary support for contact sensors via a contact system. Each collision entity that has been selected to be a contact sensor will have a ContactData component added to it by the contact system. These components get updated by the physics system at each time step. Currently, only the position of the contacts is made available. Normals and wrenches will be added in the future.

Requires:

  • ign-msgs #90
  • ign-physics #67

Note: I have modified pipelines to build ign-msgs and ign-physics from source until they get merged

values.description:
This PR adds support for component serialization / de-serialization into streams.

* It uses the **stream operators** (`<<` / `>>`) for convenience when dealing with several standard types and Ignition Math types.
* Supports **custom serialization**, which can be defined by either:
    * Overriding `De/Serialize` functions (see an example on the `LevelEntityNames` component)
    * Defining custom operators - this is less convenient because as free functions, they'd need to be implemented in a `cc` file
* Supports **components that can't be serialized**. This means there's no compilation failure for components whose data doesn't have stream operators. Instead, a warning is printed if there's an attempt to serialize/deserialize them. Take a look at the `to/fromStream` functions.

---

## Next steps

* Implement serialization for types which currently don't support it, mainly those wrapping `sdf::ElementPtr` and other SDF classes. This may involve storing Ignition Messages instead.
* Implement serialization of the whole ECM, which is already under way in the `streaming` branch.

---

Thanks @carromj for bouncing ideas about how to implement the SFINAE rules.
values.title: [A-4] Component serialization

summary.raw:
This PR adds support for component serialization / de-serialization into streams.

* It uses the **stream operators** (`<<` / `>>`) for convenience when dealing with several standard types and Ignition Math types.
* Supports **custom serialization**, which can be defined by either:
    * Overriding `De/Serialize` functions (see an example on the `LevelEntityNames` component)
    * Defining custom operators - this is less convenient because as free functions, they'd need to be implemented in a `cc` file
* Supports **components that can't be serialized**. This means there's no compilation failure for components whose data doesn't have stream operators. Instead, a warning is printed if there's an attempt to serialize/deserialize them. Take a look at the `to/fromStream` functions.

---

## Next steps

* Implement serialization for types which currently don't support it, mainly those wrapping `sdf::ElementPtr` and other SDF classes. This may involve storing Ignition Messages instead.
* Implement serialization of the whole ECM, which is already under way in the `streaming` branch.

---

Thanks @carromj for bouncing ideas about how to implement the SFINAE rules.
summary.html:
This PR adds support for component serialization / de-serialization into streams.

  • It uses the stream operators (<< / >>) for convenience when dealing with several standard types and Ignition Math types.
  • Supports custom serialization, which can be defined by either:
    • Overriding De/Serialize functions (see an example on the LevelEntityNames component)
    • Defining custom operators - this is less convenient because as free functions, they'd need to be implemented in a cc file
  • Supports components that can't be serialized. This means there's no compilation failure for components whose data doesn't have stream operators. Instead, a warning is printed if there's an attempt to serialize/deserialize them. Take a look at the to/fromStream functions.

Next steps

  • Implement serialization for types which currently don't support it, mainly those wrapping sdf::ElementPtr and other SDF classes. This may involve storing Ignition Messages instead.
  • Implement serialization of the whole ECM, which is already under way in the streaming branch.

Thanks @carromj for bouncing ideas about how to implement the SFINAE rules.

values.description:
Right now component types have 2 IDs:

* one used within the ECM, which is not guaranteed to be the same across runs or compilers
* one registered with the Factory, which is guaranteed to be the same

This is confusing and error prone. In fact, the Factory code itself is mixing up both of them, setting one as `ComponentType::id` and keeping another into its `compsById` map, so currently `Factory::New(ComponentType::id)` doesn't work.

This PR:

* **Removes the ECM's ID** and uses the one from the factory everywhere instead
* A consequence is that **all components must be registered with the factory**
* Removed `EntityComponentManager::ComponentType<Type>` since it is no longer convenient. We should use `Type::typeId` instead.
* Adds functions `TypeName` and `TypeId`, which **allow retrieving the correct type information even from a `BaseComponent` pointer**. This is helpful when using `Factory::New`.

---

## Future work

* Currently, if  someone forgets to register a component the error will manifest itself in weird ways. I'm planning to tackle this in a future pull request.

---

This is broken off the `streaming` branch.
values.title: [A-4] One component type ID

* one registered with the Factory, which is guaranteed to be the same

This PR:

* **Removes the ECM's ID** and uses the one from the factory everywhere instead
* A consequence is that **all components must be registered with the factory**
* Removed `EntityComponentManager::ComponentType<Type>` since it is no longer convenient. We should use `Type::typeId` instead.
* Adds functions `TypeName` and `TypeId`, which **allow retrieving the correct type information even from a `BaseComponent` pointer**. This is helpful when using `Factory::New`.

---

## Future work

* Currently, if  someone forgets to register a component the error will manifest itself in weird ways. I'm planning to tackle this in a future pull request.

---

This is broken off the `streaming` branch.
summary.html:
Right now component types have 2 IDs:

  • one used within the ECM, which is not guaranteed to be the same across runs or compilers
  • one registered with the Factory, which is guaranteed to be the same

This is confusing and error prone. In fact, the Factory code itself is mixing up both of them, setting one as ComponentType::id and keeping another into its compsById map, so currently Factory::New(ComponentType::id) doesn't work.

This PR:

  • Removes the ECM's ID and uses the one from the factory everywhere instead
  • A consequence is that all components must be registered with the factory
  • Removed EntityComponentManager::ComponentType<Type> since it is no longer convenient. We should use Type::typeId instead.
  • Adds functions TypeName and TypeId, which allow retrieving the correct type information even from a BaseComponent pointer. This is helpful when using Factory::New.

Future work

  • Currently, if someone forgets to register a component the error will manifest itself in weird ways. I'm planning to tackle this in a future pull request.

This is broken off the streaming branch.

values.title: Additional SFINAE for components that are pointers.

summary.html:
Adds an additional method to serialize components that are std::shared_ptr<DataType>.

@chapulina I added a simple << for sdf::Element in the integration test, but I’m pretty sure that’s not where we want that to live.

Also, I made a simple test with populating dummy data in the Altimeter. I don't think that there would be a lot of value duplicating this for all the components, since it's essentially just testing sdf::Element::ToString, but we could add corresponding tests for each sdf::Element based component.

values.description:
## Purpose

SubT needs to get bounding box information for the comms model. It only needs bounding box information at the model level. This PR *should* handle both link and model bounding boxes.

What I'm most unhappy about is the calculation of bounding information every iteration. We can live with this for the Acropolis release, but I'm open to other alternatives.

## Required PRs

These required PRs have all been merged.

* ~~#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/68~~
* ~~#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/91~~

## Testing

1. Run the shapes world: `ign-gazebo-server -r -f shapes.world -v 4`
2. Call the model info service: 

```
ign service -s /world/shapes/model/info --reqtype ignition.msgs.StringMsg --reptype ignition.msgs.Model --timeout 2000 --req 'data: "box"'
```
values.title: [Acropolis] Bounding box info

ign service -s /world/shapes/model/info --reqtype ignition.msgs.StringMsg --reptype ignition.msgs.Model --timeout 2000 --req 'data: "box"'

values.description:
We're starting to accumulate flaky tests, especially on homebrew and pipelines. I went through the homebrew ones and tried to improve some of them here.

---

I know this is far from a definitive answer, but I ran this branch ~~twice~~ 3 times on homebrew and none of the flaky tests failed. Let's hope my luck is not flaky :sweat_smile: 

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64&build=541)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/541/)

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64&build=544)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/544/)

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64&build=547)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/547/)

---

These are all the tests that failed for the latest builds on Jenkins homebrew:

Test | Status | Comment
-- | -- | --
`NetworkManager/EstablishComms` | **Very flaky**: [failed 3/8 last builds](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/46/testReport/junit/(root)/NetworkManager/EstablishComms/history/) | This PR should help
`PeerTracker/Partitioned` | **A bit flaky**: [failed 1/12 last builds](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/42/testReport/junit/(root)/PeerTracker/Partitioned/history) | This PR should help
`PeerTracker/Namespaced` | **A bit flaky**: [failed 1/12 last builds](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/42/testReport/junit/(root)/PeerTracker/Namespaced/history) | This PR should help
`ServerRepeat_DiffDriveTest` | **Fixed?**: [failed 5/13 last builds](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/35/testReport/(root)/ServerRepeat_DiffDriveTest/PublishCmd_0/history/) | All the failures came before the successes though, so it could be fixed. I also looked at it and I don't have ideas on how to improve it.
`INTEGRATION_gpu_lidar` | **Failing**: [failed 1/1 last builds](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/46/testReport/(root)/INTEGRATION_gpu_lidar/test_ran/history/) | This doesn't look flaky, it looks like a persistent failure introduced on pull request #131

We're starting to accumulate flaky tests, especially on homebrew and pipelines. I went through the homebrew ones and tried to improve some of them here.

I know this is far from a definitive answer, but I ran this branch twice 3 times on homebrew and none of the flaky tests failed. Let's hope my luck is not flaky

These are all the tests that failed for the latest builds on Jenkins homebrew:

Test Status Comment
NetworkManager/EstablishComms Very flaky: failed 3/8 last builds This PR should help
PeerTracker/Partitioned A bit flaky: failed 1/12 last builds This PR should help
PeerTracker/Namespaced A bit flaky: failed 1/12 last builds This PR should help
ServerRepeat_DiffDriveTest Fixed?: failed 5/13 last builds All the failures came before the successes though, so it could be fixed. I also looked at it and I don't have ideas on how to improve it.
INTEGRATION_gpu_lidar Failing: failed 1/1 last builds This doesn't look flaky, it looks like a persistent failure introduced on pull request #131

values.description:
This PR adds logging plugin for recording and playback.

Recording uses ign-transport messages, currently only poses are recorded \(\`/world/default/pose/info\` topic\).

* Currently SDF file is dumped to a separate text file. Later, this will need to be published on another ign-transport topic, to be recorded together with the serialized ECM.

Playback loads the `.tlog` file using ign-transport `Log.hh`. When the timestamp from world startup reaches the recorded timestamp minus recording startup, the current model poses are overwritten by the recorded ones.

* Currently only `Model` poses are played back, not `Link`, because for links with the same name but belonging to different models, there’s no way from the ign-transport messages to tell which model the link belonged to.  
  This should be resolved once we replace the pose topic with the topic with serialized ECM.

Example SDF files and a keyboard example for controlling the two vehicles are included for testing out the plugins.

## Testing

### Recording

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/standalone/keyboard/build`

`./keyboard ../keyboard.sdf`

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/worlds`

`ign-gazebo -v 4 -f log_record.sdf -r`

Use arrow keys and ASDW to move the vehicles somewhere.

### Playback

`ign-gazebo -f empty.sdf -v 4`

Physics must be off.

Fixed. **~~Intermittent bug~~**~~: Sometimes nothing is loaded into the world. Might have to do with how the SDF is loaded? Currently it's loaded using these two lines in~~ `Configure()`~~:~~

`ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator creator = ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator(_ecm, _eventMgr);`  
`creator.CreateEntities(sdf_world);`

~~Also tried putting~~ `CreateEntities()` ~~in~~ `PreUpdate()` ~~instead of~~ `Configure()`~~, in case GUI might see them as new entities. Issue persists.~~

## Next steps

Upon PR #184 completion, replace the topic used in recording and playback with the topic with serialized ECM, as well as an additional topic for the SDF string, published once at startup.
values.title: [Acropolis] Add logging

summary.raw:
This PR adds logging plugin for recording and playback.

Recording uses ign-transport messages, currently only poses are recorded \(\`/world/default/pose/info\` topic\).

* Currently SDF file is dumped to a separate text file. Later, this will need to be published on another ign-transport topic, to be recorded together with the serialized ECM.

Playback loads the `.tlog` file using ign-transport `Log.hh`. When the timestamp from world startup reaches the recorded timestamp minus recording startup, the current model poses are overwritten by the recorded ones.

* Currently only `Model` poses are played back, not `Link`, because for links with the same name but belonging to different models, there’s no way from the ign-transport messages to tell which model the link belonged to.  
  This should be resolved once we replace the pose topic with the topic with serialized ECM.

Example SDF files and a keyboard example for controlling the two vehicles are included for testing out the plugins.

## Testing

### Recording

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/standalone/keyboard/build`

`./keyboard ../keyboard.sdf`

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/worlds`

`ign-gazebo -v 4 -f log_record.sdf -r`

Use arrow keys and ASDW to move the vehicles somewhere.

### Playback

`ign-gazebo -f empty.sdf -v 4`

Physics must be off.

Fixed. **~~Intermittent bug~~**~~: Sometimes nothing is loaded into the world. Might have to do with how the SDF is loaded? Currently it's loaded using these two lines in~~ `Configure()`~~:~~

`ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator creator = ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator(_ecm, _eventMgr);`  
`creator.CreateEntities(sdf_world);`

~~Also tried putting~~ `CreateEntities()` ~~in~~ `PreUpdate()` ~~instead of~~ `Configure()`~~, in case GUI might see them as new entities. Issue persists.~~

## Next steps

Upon PR #184 completion, replace the topic used in recording and playback with the topic with serialized ECM, as well as an additional topic for the SDF string, published once at startup.
summary.html:
This PR adds logging plugin for recording and playback.

Recording uses ign-transport messages, currently only poses are recorded (`/world/default/pose/info` topic).

  • Currently SDF file is dumped to a separate text file. Later, this will need to be published on another ign-transport topic, to be recorded together with the serialized ECM.

Playback loads the .tlog file using ign-transport Log.hh. When the timestamp from world startup reaches the recorded timestamp minus recording startup, the current model poses are overwritten by the recorded ones.

  • Currently only Model poses are played back, not Link, because for links with the same name but belonging to different models, there’s no way from the ign-transport messages to tell which model the link belonged to.
    This should be resolved once we replace the pose topic with the topic with serialized ECM.

Example SDF files and a keyboard example for controlling the two vehicles are included for testing out the plugins.

Testing

Recording

cd ign-gazebo/examples/standalone/keyboard/build

./keyboard ../keyboard.sdf

cd ign-gazebo/examples/worlds

ign-gazebo -v 4 -f log_record.sdf -r

Use arrow keys and ASDW to move the vehicles somewhere.

Playback

ign-gazebo -f empty.sdf -v 4

Physics must be off.

Fixed. Intermittent bug: Sometimes nothing is loaded into the world. Might have to do with how the SDF is loaded? Currently it's loaded using these two lines in Configure():

ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator creator = ignition::gazebo::SdfEntityCreator(_ecm, _eventMgr);
creator.CreateEntities(sdf_world);

Also tried putting CreateEntities() in PreUpdate() instead of Configure(), in case GUI might see them as new entities. Issue persists.

Next steps

Upon PR #184 completion, replace the topic used in recording and playback with the topic with serialized ECM, as well as an additional topic for the SDF string, published once at startup.

values.description:
Add a pose\_publisher system that can be attached to models to publish pose of its links. Pose The system takes optional sdf arguments to also allow publishing of collision and visual pose data if needed.

To test, launch gazebo with the example world:

```
ign-gazebo -v4 -f examples/worlds/pose_publisher.sdf
```

and listen to the pose topic

```
ign topic -e -t "/model/double_pendulum_with_base/pose
```

‌

There is also an [accompanying PR in ros1\_ign\_bridge](https://github.com/osrf/ros1_ign_bridge/pull/4) \(update: PR merged\). The bridge converts the ign pose msgs to TFs , e.g.

```
roscore &
parameter_bridge /model/double_pendulum_with_base/pose@geometry_msgs/TransformStamped@ignition.msgs.Pose &
rostopic echo /model/double_pendulum_with_base/pose
```
values.title: [A-8] Add pose publisher system

summary.html:
Add a pose_publisher system that can be attached to models to publish pose of its links. Pose The system takes optional sdf arguments to also allow publishing of collision and visual pose data if needed.

To test, launch gazebo with the example world:

ign-gazebo -v4 -f examples/worlds/pose_publisher.sdf

and listen to the pose topic

ign topic -e -t "/model/double_pendulum_with_base/pose

values.description:
This is a port of the [Touch Plugin](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/bd1cdea8fa3d71d6afcdaa83c9b01891d5f72e71/plugins/TouchPlugin.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) from osrf/Gazebo. 

** Differences from the classical TouchPlugin**

* This port removes the `<sensor>` parameter as the collisions that are marked as contact sensors within a model are determined from the component assigned to them by the Contact system. And since the contact data is accessed via components, there is no means to select the contacts generated by a particular sensor.
* The type for the output topic is `Boolean` instead of `Int`.
* The enable mechanism uses a service instead of a regular pub/sub topic

**Requirements**

* ign-gazebo pull request #174.

** Differences from the classical TouchPlugin**

* This port removes the `<sensor>` parameter as the collisions that are marked as contact sensors within a model are determined from the component assigned to them by the Contact system. And since the contact data is accessed via components, there is no means to select the contacts generated by a particular sensor.
* The type for the output topic is `Boolean` instead of `Int`.
* The enable mechanism uses a service instead of a regular pub/sub topic

**Requirements**

* ign-gazebo pull request #174.
summary.html:
This is a port of the Touch Plugin from osrf/Gazebo.

Differences from the classical TouchPlugin

  • This port removes the <sensor> parameter as the collisions that are marked as contact sensors within a model are determined from the component assigned to them by the Contact system. And since the contact data is accessed via components, there is no means to select the contacts generated by a particular sensor.
  • The type for the output topic is Boolean instead of Int.
  • The enable mechanism uses a service instead of a regular pub/sub topic

Requirements

  • ign-gazebo pull request #174.

values.title: [Acropolis] Complete state streaming

summary.html:
This PR allows serializing / deserializing the entire state of the ECM.

  • Add operators (<< / >>) to ECM - I recommend taking a look at the documentation and tests.
  • Add protobuf messages to conveniently store the ECM's serialized state

Update

The initial approach in this PR is not flexible enough, so I'm working on an updated API which should be able to cover several use cases:

  • Logging to a file and playing back
  • Syncing distributed simulation
  • Skipping to keyframes during simulation (used by undo / redo)

Depending on the use case, you may want to:

  • Get the whole state or only some entities / components
  • Override the whole absolute state or update the state incrementally
  • Choose which components to store based on typeId (efficient) or typeName (user-friendly)

So I'm thinking of removing the operators from the ECM and implementing the following API instead:

/// \brief Get a message with the serialized state of the given entities and components.
/// \param[in] _types Type ID of components to be serialized. Leave empty to get all
/// components.
/// \param[in] _entities Entities to be serialized. Leave empty to get all entities.
msgs::SerializedState State(
    std::vector<ComponentTypeId> _types = std::vector<ComponentTypeId>(),
    std::vector<Entity> _entities = std::vector<Entity>) const;

/// \brief Get a message with the serialized state of the given entities and components.
/// \param[in] _types Registered type names of components to be serialized. Leave empty to
/// get all components.
/// \param[in] _entities Entities to be serialized. Leave empty to get all entities.
msgs::SerializedState State(
    std::vector<std::string> _types = std::vector<std::string>(),
    std::vector<Entity> _entities = std::vector<Entity>) const;

/// \brief Get a message with the serialized state of the given entities and components, only if
/// they're being changed (or created / removed) in this iteration.
/// Future work, ECM needs to track changed components first
msgs::SerializedState ChangedState(std::vector<std::string/ComponentTypeId> _types, std::vector<Entity> _entities) const;

/// \brief Set the absolute state of the ECM from a serialized message. 
/// Entities / components that are in the new state but not in the old one will be created.
/// Entities / components that are marked as removed will be removed, but they won't be 
/// removed if they're not present in the state.
void SetState(msgs::SerializedState);

I'll also add a boolean removed field to SerializedEntity and SerializedComponent messages.

Let me know what you think of this plan, @carromj

Update 2

Implemented the changes above, this is ready for review again.

Update 3

This PR now requires this ign-msgs PR: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/99/

values.description:
This PR allows for complete primary and secondary integration, with syncronous stepping of all of the secondaries.

It additionally distributes the “performer affinity”, which assigns which performers will be simulated on particular secondaries in the network graph.

There is currently a performance regression in the interaction with the LevelManager system that I am working to resolve.
values.title: [Acropolis] Distribute performer affinities.

summary.raw:
This PR allows for complete primary and secondary integration, with syncronous stepping of all of the secondaries.

It additionally distributes the “performer affinity”, which assigns which performers will be simulated on particular secondaries in the network graph.

There is currently a performance regression in the interaction with the LevelManager system that I am working to resolve.
summary.html:
This PR allows for complete primary and secondary integration, with syncronous stepping of all of the secondaries.

It additionally distributes the “performer affinity”, which assigns which performers will be simulated on particular secondaries in the network graph.

There is currently a performance regression in the interaction with the LevelManager system that I am working to resolve.

values.description:
Split off from PR #181. This PR adds keyboard control for vehicles in`diff_drive`.

## Testing

In one terminal:

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/standalone/keyboard/build`

`./keyboard ../keyboard.sdf`

In second terminal:

`cd ign-gazebo/examples/worlds`

`ign-gazebo -v 4 -f diff_drive.sdf -r`

Switch active window to first terminal. Use the arrow keys to control one vehicle, and ASDW to control the other.

values.description:
* Update the factory so it can also be used to create new component storages. This is needed when populating the ECM from a serialized state, at which point we can't call templated functions.

* The factory and components no longer stores type names. The registered type names were being cleaned up during tests, but not the type IDs. @caguero and I debugged a bit with no success, so the current workaround is to remove names completely, since they're not being used anyway. :warning: We may just be pushing the issue down the road, it would be nice to eventually understand why the names were being reset.

---

This is needed by pull request #184
values.title: [A-4] Storage factory

summary.raw:
* Update the factory so it can also be used to create new component storages. This is needed when populating the ECM from a serialized state, at which point we can't call templated functions.

* The factory and components no longer stores type names. The registered type names were being cleaned up during tests, but not the type IDs. @caguero and I debugged a bit with no success, so the current workaround is to remove names completely, since they're not being used anyway. :warning: We may just be pushing the issue down the road, it would be nice to eventually understand why the names were being reset.

---

This is needed by pull request #184
summary.html:
• Update the factory so it can also be used to create new component storages. This is needed when populating the ECM from a serialized state, at which point we can't call templated functions.

  • The factory and components no longer stores type names. The registered type names were being cleaned up during tests, but not the type IDs. @caguero and I debugged a bit with no success, so the current workaround is to remove names completely, since they're not being used anyway. We may just be pushing the issue down the road, it would be nice to eventually understand why the names were being reset.

This is needed by pull request #184

values.description: This allows for the user to pass a world string into the ServerConfig. In this specific case, it is used to pass a world without physics into the network\_handshake integration test to circumvent some ODE issues with multiple physics systems per executable.

values.description:
For fun I tried bumping the version of gazebo to 1, and ran into some compile problems.

This PR should resolve the compile issues, however there is a run-time problem. All of our SDF files utilize version numbers when loading plugins. For example:

```
    <plugin
      filename="libignition-gazebo0-physics-system.so"
      name="ignition::gazebo::systems::v0::Physics">
    </plugin>
```

I have two questions:

1. Do we need a version number for both the library (e.g. the zero in `libignition-gazebo0-physics-system.so`) and in the interface (e.g. the `v0` in `ignition::gazebo::systems::v0::Physics`)? If not, can we get away with just the library version number? 

2. We can save this for Blueprint, but do we want to cmake-configure all of our SDF files to insert the current project major number? There are example and test SDF files to consider.

# Commits

1. 81e7645 : Alters the `kDefaultWorld` variable so that it's constructed using version information.
2. f40c64b : Ran `sed` to fix all the SDF files.
3.  71c1699 : Version the GUI library
4. e162e00 : Initial compile time only fix.
values.title: Working on a version issue

summary.raw:
For fun I tried bumping the version of gazebo to 1, and ran into some compile problems.

This PR should resolve the compile issues, however there is a run-time problem. All of our SDF files utilize version numbers when loading plugins. For example:

```
    <plugin
      filename="libignition-gazebo0-physics-system.so"
      name="ignition::gazebo::systems::v0::Physics">
    </plugin>
```

I have two questions:

1. Do we need a version number for both the library (e.g. the zero in `libignition-gazebo0-physics-system.so`) and in the interface (e.g. the `v0` in `ignition::gazebo::systems::v0::Physics`)? If not, can we get away with just the library version number? 

2. We can save this for Blueprint, but do we want to cmake-configure all of our SDF files to insert the current project major number? There are example and test SDF files to consider.

# Commits

1. 81e7645 : Alters the `kDefaultWorld` variable so that it's constructed using version information.
2. f40c64b : Ran `sed` to fix all the SDF files.
3.  71c1699 : Version the GUI library
4. e162e00 : Initial compile time only fix.
summary.html:
For fun I tried bumping the version of gazebo to 1, and ran into some compile problems.

This PR should resolve the compile issues, however there is a run-time problem. All of our SDF files utilize version numbers when loading plugins. For example:

    <plugin
      filename="libignition-gazebo0-physics-system.so"
      name="ignition::gazebo::systems::v0::Physics">
    </plugin>

I have two questions:

  1. Do we need a version number for both the library (e.g. the zero in libignition-gazebo0-physics-system.so) and in the interface (e.g. the v0 in ignition::gazebo::systems::v0::Physics)? If not, can we get away with just the library version number?

  2. We can save this for Blueprint, but do we want to cmake-configure all of our SDF files to insert the current project major number? There are example and test SDF files to consider.

Commits

  1. 81e7645 : Alters the kDefaultWorld variable so that it's constructed using version information.
  2. f40c64b : Ran sed to fix all the SDF files.
  3. 71c1699 : Version the GUI library
  4. e162e00 : Initial compile time only fix.

values.description: This changes all `ignition::gazebo::systems::v0` -> `ignition::gazebo::v0::systems` and `ignition::gazebo::events::v0` -> `ignition::gazebo::v0::events`
values.title: [Acropolis] Change usage of our version inline namespace so that it comes right after ignition::gazebo

summary.raw: This changes all `ignition::gazebo::systems::v0` -> `ignition::gazebo::v0::systems` and `ignition::gazebo::events::v0` -> `ignition::gazebo::v0::events`
summary.html: This changes all ignition::gazebo::systems::v0 -> ignition::gazebo::v0::systems and ignition::gazebo::events::v0 -> ignition::gazebo::v0::events

values.description:
While iterating we've tried a couple different directory structures for systems. It's good to make the pattern uniform before the first release, so this PR changes the outliers.

* Moved `diff_drive` and `scene_broadcaster` into their own components and their headers are no longer installed.
* Renamed the `usercommands` dir to `user_commands`
* Moved the `Null` system to `test/plugins` since it isn't used
* Removed the `ignition-gazebo-systems.so` library since each system will be in its own lib.

The diff is large but _I promise_ all I did was moving files, except for:

* Fixing the library names in SDF files
* Changing `ignition/plugin/RegisterMore` to `ignition/plugin/Register` in the plugins that are now alone in a lib
* Changing the includes for the moved headers
* Changed/added cmake files for the new structure
* Stopped installing test plugins
values.title: [Acropolis] Consolidate system directory structure

summary.raw:
While iterating we've tried a couple different directory structures for systems. It's good to make the pattern uniform before the first release, so this PR changes the outliers.

* Moved `diff_drive` and `scene_broadcaster` into their own components and their headers are no longer installed.
* Renamed the `usercommands` dir to `user_commands`
* Moved the `Null` system to `test/plugins` since it isn't used
* Removed the `ignition-gazebo-systems.so` library since each system will be in its own lib.

The diff is large but _I promise_ all I did was moving files, except for:

* Fixing the library names in SDF files
* Changing `ignition/plugin/RegisterMore` to `ignition/plugin/Register` in the plugins that are now alone in a lib
* Changing the includes for the moved headers
* Changed/added cmake files for the new structure
* Stopped installing test plugins
summary.html:
While iterating we've tried a couple different directory structures for systems. It's good to make the pattern uniform before the first release, so this PR changes the outliers.

  • Moved diff_drive and scene_broadcaster into their own components and their headers are no longer installed.
  • Renamed the usercommands dir to user_commands
  • Moved the Null system to test/plugins since it isn't used
  • Removed the ignition-gazebo-systems.so library since each system will be in its own lib.

The diff is large but I promise all I did was moving files, except for:

  • Fixing the library names in SDF files
  • Changing ignition/plugin/RegisterMore to ignition/plugin/Register in the plugins that are now alone in a lib
  • Changing the includes for the moved headers
  • Changed/added cmake files for the new structure
  • Stopped installing test plugins

values.description:
The first commit is some issues that I had with “ambiguous namespace” compiler errors on my system.  I’m not sure why these are popping up/required now.

The second commit makes the initialization of the typeId happen outside of factory registration and as a normal static initialization.  I think that this may resolve issues with macOS clang.
values.title: [Blueprint, also may not be need] Attempt to fix macOS CI for storage_factory

summary.raw:
The first commit is some issues that I had with “ambiguous namespace” compiler errors on my system.  I’m not sure why these are popping up/required now.

The second commit makes the initialization of the typeId happen outside of factory registration and as a normal static initialization.  I think that this may resolve issues with macOS clang.
summary.html:
The first commit is some issues that I had with “ambiguous namespace” compiler errors on my system. I’m not sure why these are popping up/required now.

The second commit makes the initialization of the typeId happen outside of factory registration and as a normal static initialization. I think that this may resolve issues with macOS clang.

values.reason: The CI issues managed to resolve themselves, so this fix is likely not needed.
